channel.title: Wine
channel.description: Will they ever perfect it? I really want to change to Ubuntu, but it's disability to run EXEs is bothering me. I am meaning they will make WINE run any exe file and take off viruses. In fact, I don't really care about the viruses that much. Windows has a problem. Maybe Linux can buy the EXE running source from Windows, and tweak it up a bit.

item.title: Wine
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

There is no ‘exe running source’ You kind of need to understand what WINE is first. First of all, .exe files are nothing but windows executables, which WINE can and does execute perfectly. The problem lies in the various system calls to windows library functions, which are not open source and need to be re-written from scratch with little to no documentation as to how they are supposed to work, as you can imagine this is hard to do perfectly.

However, if you plan on only running windows executables, switching to linux would be stupid, one of the main reasons to switch should be so you can run linux executables.

Read full topic

item.title: Wine
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

If Linux had buy the EXE running source, Microsoft had been bankrupt very quiqly.

So Microsoft would not sell.

Read full topic

Are you kidding?How does this not relate to graphics besides the whole topic of course.[/quote]

normally I would have answered his question anyways, but this was more of a pathetic rant to make it seem like he knew what he was talking about.
